global_notes: Single baseline group G1 confirmed, matching the surface exactly. No adjustments to baseline-group assignments. All 45 specification_results.csv rows belong to G1. The surface core_universe explicitly includes rc/form/outcome/* and rc/joint/outcome_*/* specs; alternative mental health indices (z_somatic, z_nonsomatic, sum_srq) are treated as measures of the same outcome concept (mental distress from curfew). All 45 rows are valid and core. One minor metadata note: for rc/joint/bw_poly/* rows, the design.regression_discontinuity.poly_order field in coefficient_vector_json records 1 (the template default) rather than 2, while the joint.details.poly_order field correctly records 2 and the executed coefficients match local-quadratic run012 exactly, confirming correct execution. Inference variants appear only in inference_results.csv (2 rows) as required; no infer/* rows are present in specification_results.csv.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Sharp RD effect of age-based COVID-19 curfew (born before December 1955, age >= 65) on mental distress (z_depression, ICW-weighted SRQ index), at the age-65 threshold, among Turkish adults near the curfew cutoff
baseline_groups.outcome_concept: Mental distress index (inverse-covariance-weighted average of 20 SRQ items, normalized to control-group SD)
baseline_groups.treatment_concept: Exposure to age-based COVID-19 curfew (born before December 1955, age >= 65)
baseline_groups.estimand_concept: Sharp RD treatment effect at age-65 curfew cutoff on mental health
baseline_groups.target_population: Turkish adults near the age-65 curfew threshold, surveyed by phone during COVID-19
baseline_groups.expected_sign_rationale: The paper argues curfew restricts movement and social interaction, increasing mental distress. All 45 executed coefficients are positive.
baseline_groups.notes: Four paper-reported baselines from Table 4 (columns 1-4). Primary baseline is bw=30, local linear, full controls, clustered at modate (run001). The surface designates run001 as the primary baseline; runs 002-004 anchor the other bandwidth columns from Table 4. bw17 is not significant due to low power (N=486); bw45 and bw60 are significant. The design block in coefficient_vector_json (poly_order=1 template) is consistent for bw_poly joint rows where the actual poly_order=2 is recorded only in joint.details; execution is verified correct.
